annotation.spannedText: Vaccination protects the person at risk of catching chickenpox through close contact

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccination protects the person at risk of catching chickenpox through close contact

annotation.spannedText: If you think that you or a member of your family or household needs the chickenpox vaccine, contact your GP for advice

classMention.mentionClass: If you think that you or a member of your family or household needs the chickenpox vaccine, contact your GP for advice

annotation.spannedText: People who should not have the chickenpox vaccine include: anyone who has had a serious allergic reaction (anaphylactic reaction) to a previous dose of the vaccine or to any of the ingredients in the vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: People who should not have the chickenpox vaccine include: anyone who has had a serious allergic reaction (anaphylactic reaction) to a previous dose of the vaccine or to any of the ingredients in the vaccine

annotation.spannedText: ask your GP if you're unsure whether this applies to you

classMention.mentionClass: ask your GP if you're unsure whether this applies to you

annotation.spannedText: pregnant women – if you have the chickenpox vaccine, try to avoid becoming pregnant within one month of the last dose

classMention.mentionClass: pregnant women – if you have the chickenpox vaccine, try to avoid becoming pregnant within one month of the last dose
